name: market for operation, housing system, cattle, tied, per animal unit | operation, housing system, cattle, tied, per animal unit | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7374/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'operation, housing system, cattle, tied, per animal unit', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This is an immobile infrastructure, representing the operation of a tied cattle housing system. The operation is scaled to 1 livestock unit (LU) during 1 year. The process  includes the use of energy and auxiliary materials for the operation of lighting, storage and drying of roughage, slurry agitator, milking machine, milk cooling, cleaning, drinking water. 

This activity starts with the built infrastructure ready to use.

This activity ends with the infrastructure made accessible to the users. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/014:Animal production/0141:Raising of cattle and buffaloes
